revised_title: Ocular Vergence Under Natural Conditions: Gaze Shifts Between Real Targets Differing in Distance and Direction
tldr: This study investigates ocular vergence and gaze shifts between real targets differing in distance and direction. The research focuses on symmetrical and asymmetrical vergence responses, finding that asymmetrical vergence is largely saccadic, while symmetrical vergence is primarily smooth. The results suggest that the oculomotor system is capable of effective binocular vision under natural conditions, despite previous observations suggesting otherwise.
